name: slavefreetrade
goal:
slavefreetrade is a Geneva-based non-profit association whose mission is to eradicate all forms of contemporary slavery. Our strategy pivots the traditional approach of incapacitating or prosecuting supply, to focus on promoting demand for slave-free goods and services. As 90% of slavery exists within the private sector; and 71% of businesses admit to having slavery, or there being a risk of slavery in their supply chains; the elimination of slavery rests significantly with ‘clean’ business supply chains.
We will achieve our mission with support from our Patron, Ms Urmila Bhoola – United Nations Special Rapporteur on contemporary forms of slavery; our International Advisory Board and a global multidisciplinary team. Our collective focus is on mobilising consumers, investors, insurers, and governments to demand slave-free products, thereby influencing businesses to thoroughly investigate and cleanse their supply chains. In parallel, we will audit company supply chains against the highest international standard – as developed by slavefreetrade – and certify compliant companies as free of slavery and other exploitative practices. Products and services certified by us will bear a consumer-facing slavefreetrade label
